page.title: 07EDDLETHORPE DAIRY HERD.
page.content: This pedigree Friesian dairy herd has been reduced from 120 to 80 cows, keeping those that produce the best {butter-fat}in the milk.He feeds them on{Wheat}to raise the fat content,the amount varys according to each cow's yield.His red/white and black/white Friesians each have a pedigree name, a herd number and a{Ministry of {Agriculture}number. Milking is at 5am and 4pm.12 cows milk at one time,staying at their place and eating their feed.Producing 8-10gallons normally,they can reach 20 gallons,at 8% butter fat!They give the most milk after calving and "dry up" before the birth of the next calf. The milk is drawn through "liners" attached to each of her four teats, collected in 24 gallon jars,measured and recorded on computer.It is sampled weekly to check her yield and content.
